Posts.Content: Always go with you gut feeling.  Your doctor works for you.  My friend found a lump and the doctor said it was nothing.  Went back in a year later,  lump still there but doctor said it was nothing.  She pushed for more test.  Cancer.  Thankfully they did catch it in time.  She had to have lymphnodes removed also. Trust you gut. Donna
Posts.Title: mammogram at a young age?!? dr. said NO!

Posts.Content: The best thing to do is go to your doctor.  Be completely honest with him.  Let him check it out.  One of my boys actually had a lump on his breast and we were concern.  I took him to the doctor and learn that some boys will develop lumps in their breast during the teen years because their body is changing. That was all it was to it. I would make an appointment and talk with the doctor.
Posts.Title: Worried about Breast Cancer

Posts.Content: If it turns out to be something, then you have to take oneday at a time.  I just had a friend finish her treatment for breast cancer.  She did wonderful. Do you have a relationship with God?  You must first trust Him in ALL things.  When I am afraid I usually find a Bible verse to help me through whatever I dealing with at the time.  Psalm 56:3-4  When I am afraid.  I will trust in you.  In God, whose word I praise, in God I trust; I will not be afraid. Did you make your appointment yet?  That is the first step.   I will pray for you.  Please keep me informed.
Posts.Title: Worried about Breast Cancer
